title: (x) IKEA serif face - New Century Schoolbook (custom version) {Geoff}
content:
Hmm, does anyone know what font this is?

I thought it was easy-peasy, it looking so familiar, but as it turned out, not for me.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20111215103510im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ikea1.jpg)
author: karenhuang

comments.content: I think this might be a custom New Century Schoolbook, IKEA property.
One of my first guesses, but the wedge serif on the lc a is not there. :(
Sorry, I shouldn't edit! I'm sure I read somewhere that IKEA had New Century Schoolbook redrawn custom along with Futura, I'll see if I can find out.

I downloaded the IKEA catalogue PDF with the fonts embedded, this is what I get in font properties, IKEA-Serif.

I'm 99% sure it's a custom New Century Schoolbook.

Ok, enough type-nerding for the day. :^)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20111215103510im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ikeaserif.png)

Hmm, some great sleuthing there. No wonder it's not so easy to pin down...

Next question I suppose would be, are there any fonts out there with a similar combination of wedge serifs and ball terminals?

Which classification would this fall under anyway?

I'd suggest that it partly falls into slab serif like Clarendon.  
Tim
